pullRequest.title: Private IP Manager to Support IP Address Replacement
pullRequest.bodyText:
Private IP Manager to support IP address replacement
Ignite Support Batch Insertion, add a new interface named addItems which allows add a list of items to Ignite DB/Cache

commit.message:
Merge pull request #1 from futurewei-cloud/master

merge
[New API Request] Private IP Manager to support IP address replacement #218
[New API Request] Private IP Manager to support IP address replacement #218

nodes.bodyText: Since PortContext is shared by multiple modules, is the meaning of the name result unclear?

There is no need to set FixedIps for oldPortEntity, please refer to the latest code: https://github.com/futurewei-cloud/alcor/blob/master/services/port_manager/src/main/java/com/futurewei/alcor/portmanager/processor/PortProcessor.java
Please delete the useless code
If subnetIds.size () is 0, is there no need to send a request?
Why do we need to update OldPortEntity here?
If hasSubnetFixedIps.size () is 0 and hasIpFixedIps.size () > 0,whether the method this::updateFixedIpsCallBack should be called?
What happens if subnetEntities.size() < hasSubnetFixedIps.size()?

Should be context.getResult().get(0).getNewIpAddrRequests()?
If send() throws an exception, shouldn't rollback be called? Because updateIpAddress didn't succeed.
So we need to decide whether we need a rollback based on whether the result is empty or not.
Should be equest.getNewIpAddrRequests().iterator() here ?
If HasSubnetFixedIps.size () > 1 and all have the same subnetId, will all FixedIp have the same ipAddr?
Why do we set the new ip to OldIpAddrRequests? Does it cause misunderstanding?
Whether there is no need to distinguish between one or more here, just deal it as multiple case?
